title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The FTC is preparing to take a harder line on drug-company mergers, outlining plans to overhaul its process for reviewing deals that could harm competition in the pharmaceutical industry.

---

Uber said it would grant its U.K. drivers an employment status entitling them to vacation pay and pension contributions.

---

Google said it would cut the service fee it collects on the first $1 million developers earn from its app store to 15% from 30%.

---

Purdue Pharma's owners agreed to pay roughly $4.28 billion, a larger sum than previously promised, to resolve lawsuits stemming from the opioid epidemic.

---

FirstEnergy reached a deal with Icahn that would give him two seats on the Ohio utility's board.

---

The Dow and S&P 500 declined 0.4% and 0.2%, respectively, while the Nasdaq edged up 0.09%.

---

Nokia plans to cut up to 11% of its workforce over the next two years as it seeks to become more competitive in the 5G-equipment market.

---

EToro said it will go public through a deal to merge with a SPAC that would value the firm at about $10.4 billion.

---

A teenager accused of breaking into Twitter's systems and impersonating some of its most popular users as part of a cryptocurrency scam pleaded guilty.

---

Visa and Mastercard are postponing planned swipe-fee increases.
